RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIRATE broke in at the start under hustling, dueled from the two path with ARTETA to his outside, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch set down for the drive, edged clear under a drive to prevail. JUST STEEL shied in at the start under hustling filling the space left vacant by PIRATE, raced briefly two to three wide before tipping out to the four path five furlongs from home, tucked three wide through the turn advancing lightly coaxed along at the three-eighths, swung three wide at the quarter pole, then shied out being shown a left handed crop to the five path straightened away in upper stretch, ran on to chase the winner home clear of the rest and along second best. SPECIAL ELEMENT coaxed from the gate, chased five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled out six wide into upper stretch and improved position staying on one paced to the finish. SHERIFF JOE coaxed from the gate, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home and made no impact. ARTETA broke in at the start under hustling, dueled three then two wide with PIRATE to his inside, came under coaxing nearing the quarter pole, got shaken off and drifted four wide into upper stretch, then tired in the drive. SAISIR LE JOUR coaxed from the start, chased four then three wide coaxed along from midway on the turn, angled five wide into upper stretch, trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Pirate
ENTRY.OWNER: Harrell Ventures LLC and Starlight Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, hustled st, dueled 2p, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Just Steel
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in, hustled st, chased 4-3w, bid, shied 5w uppr, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Saisir Le Jour
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Special Element
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 5-6w backstretch, ins turn, angled 6w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Arteta
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, hustled st, dueled 3-2w, coaxed near 1/4, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 5w backstretch, 2p turn, 2-3w upper, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 88. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allow ed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TALKIN PHAROAH dropped back off the pace then came under urging, went three then four wide on the turn, rallied outside into upper stretch, closed well to get the lead into the final furlong, disposed of the runner-up under a left-handed crop shortly thereafter and drew clear under strong urging. WIN FOR GOLD dueled on the inside of a foe, vied along the rail while still inside that opponent on the turn, shook clear coming to the quarter-pole, was roused for more into upper stretch, lost the advantage to the winner under the crop into the final furlong and proved no match while just able to hold the place. SUGAR GRAY LEONARD was ridden along off the pace, raced inside to the two path on the turn, moved out while gaining inside the three-sixteenths, chased outside into the final furlong and flattened out then just missed the place but was well clear for the show. TOMMY GUN was hustled from the gate then ridden along off the pace, dropped from the two path to the rail early on the turn, spun back into the two path entering the stretch and failed to threaten. CHARLIE FIVE O settled on the outside, moved in late on the backstretch, went three wide on the turn and was no factor. EAST COAST GIRL dueled on the outside of a foe, vied in the two then three path on the turn, dropped back nearing the quarter-pole and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Win for Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Ten Strike Racing Four Corners Racing Broadview Stables and Cory Moelis Racing L
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside foe,rail turn,clear 1/4,headed1/8,no match,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Gray Leonard
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden along,ins-2path turn,mvd out ins3/16,flattened,miss2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,ridden along,2p-ins turn,2p into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: East Coast Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled outside, 2-3path turn, dropped back 1/4, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Talkin Pharoah
ENTRY.COMMENT: drop back,urged,3-4w turn,rallied,lead1/8,drew clear,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie Five O
ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable Flower Power Stables and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,moved in 1/2,3wide turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 88. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). ( Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EPIC MISS JUSTICE three then two wide through the first turn, chased three then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths stacked outside a trio just in behind the top pair, swung five wide into upper stretch, offered up a good finish to close in and was just up in a blanket finish on the wire. WHY WASTE WORDS coaxed from the gate, saved ground in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out five to six wide into upper stretch, offered up a good finish closing fastest of all late, got bumped steps from the wire by KING'S SECRET looking to thread a space inside her between foes and just missed at the end. KING'S SECRET (GB) tracked along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and had no clear lane in front, tipped out three paths to a seam between EPIC MISS JUSTICE and WHY WASTE WORDS, bumped with WHY WASTE WORDS in the final jumps when trying to split those rivals and missed at the finish. BEST PERFORMER forwardly placed three wide through the first turn, dueled in hand three then two wide with VANISHED to her inside, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, shook away briefly a furlong out, then dug in under threat from a host of rivals and was nailed when overwhelmed late. NO DELI (IRE) just off the inside tracking the pair up front in closest aim, came under coaxing bidding at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive between foes through the final furlong and was outfinished in the late stages when running on to the wire. HEAVENLY APPOINTED chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was outkicked in the late going. HOLA GATA four wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide offering up a bid near the five-sixteenths, angled four wide for home unable to sustain the momentum and weakened through to the finish. TACITURN two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing three to four wide at the three-eighths, angled inwards to the two path at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and offered no response. ISOLA (IRE) grew rank under restraint early on along the inside near the rear of the field skygazing before settling into the first turn, chased along the inside and then just off the inside, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and made no impact when never fully engaged by the rider. VANISHED dueled inside of BEST PERFORMER while under rating, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired. PARIS STYLE (FR) two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three to four wide for home and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Isola (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of FBL

ENTRY.OWNER: Calvert Chad RAP Racing and Grund David
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank under restraint early ins, chased ins, ins 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: King's Secret (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4, tip out 1/16p, bump foe, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Why Waste Words
ENTRY.OWNER: Six Column Stables LLC Bloch Randall L Seiler John Hall David and Nafzger Wanda
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, saved grd mid pack, 5-6w uppr, gd finish, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Paris Style (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Walking L Thoroughbreds LLC and Three Chimneys Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners Barber Gary and Rocco Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled rated ins, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Taciturn
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3-4w 3/8, angled 2p 5/16, 2w 1/4p, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Heavenly Appointed
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, mild bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: No Deli (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, bid coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, dug in, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Hola Gata
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, bid 5/16, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Epic Miss Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, chased 3-4w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, gd finish, up

ENTRY.NAME: Best Performer
ENTRY.OWNER: Kirk Kat and Sanders Wayne R
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled in hand 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, dug in, nailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Diana S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 4 1 1/8M Turf CR: 106. Stakes Purse 500000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHITEBEAM (GB) broke in and brushed the gate then bumped lightly with a foe, was taken under a snug hold while moving forward early, tucked into the two path for most of the first turn then shifted to the three path, stalked the leader on the outside down the backstretch, turned up the pressure in the three path on the far turn, was roused outside the quarter-pole then came under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, fought on even terms for the lead while outside the runner-up into the final furlong, was brushed by that foe near the sixteenth-pole, continued the tussle to the finish and got up on the line to narrowly prevail. IN ITALIAN (GB) came away in good order and went straight to the front, showed the way in the two path, was asked at the top of the stretch, came under a right-handed crop outside the eighth-pole, battled inside the winner into the final furlong, drifted out near the sixteenth-pole and brushed with that foe, led under a drive to the final stride but was denied while able to hold the place. FEV ROVER (IRE) became very fractious in the gate, was backed out and deemed fit to run by the state veterinarian then reloaded, was rated just off the pace on the inside, came under urging on the final turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, angled out behind the top two in the vicinity of the furlong marker, gained with good courage late and finished willingly but missed while well clear for the show. MARKETSEGMENTATION bumped lightly with a rival at the start while last away then moved out while taken in hand, lost touch quickly with the top three, traveled around the opening bend in the two path, was reserved towards the back, went two then three wide under urging on the final turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and lacked the needed response. FLUFFY SOCKS was restless in the gate, bumped lightly with foes at the start, moved in over heels while taken in hand early, was reserved at the rear while saving ground, raced under urging on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and failed to rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Fev Rover (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: very fractious gate,just off pace,ins,ask2nd,angled out,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: In Italian (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,showed way 2path,ask1/4,drift out 1/16,brushed,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Marketsegmentation
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,in hand,mvd out,2p1st,reserved,2-3p2nd,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Fluffy Socks
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate,light bump brk,in hand,reserved inside,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Whitebeam (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,brshd gate,light bump,3p,stlkd outside,bid5/16,duel,up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARIACHI two to three wide in closest aim of the leader latched on to the outside, took over command at the seven-sixteenths, showed the way just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to prevail. ZEEBEAR showed the way along the inside early on under pressure from the aforementioned foe to the outside, yielded command at the seven-sixteenths and chased along the inside through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch, ran on along the rail to secure the place honors. G MUNNING chased four then three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home, kept on to secure the show honors. ALWAYS CHARMING chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. ON THE HILL broke out at the start bumping NINETEEN OYSTERS, chased just off the inside under a ride from the three-eighths, angled out four to five wide into upper stretch and weakened. RED D G P four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing three furlongs out, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and made no impact. AGILITY got bumped at the start by NINETEEN OYSTERS, then got steadied as RED D G P crossed in front and conceded three to four lengths to the front, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four then three wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch and tired. NINETEEN OYSTERS broke out at at the start bumping AGILITY and then got bumped by ON THE HILL breaking outwards and conceded three to four lengths to the front, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled four wide for home and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Zeebear
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early ins, chased ins turn, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Always Charming
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: On the Hill
ENTRY.OWNER: Bond Racing Stable and DutchessViews Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 4-5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out, bumped st, chased 3-2w, angled 4w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Agility
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, steady st, 5w backstretch, 4-3w turn, 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Red D G P
ENTRY.OWNER: McMahon Joseph G McMahon Anne Buchakjian Kyle Buchakjian Richard and Plummer Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: G Munning
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Mariachi
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w in aim, took over 7/16, 2p turn, 2w 1/4p, edged away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 1M Inner turf CR: 89. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER SKILLET established a forward position early, raced in the two path under a tight hold on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was given cover behind the leader near the nine-sixteenths, stalked in the two path on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, took the lead while asked for her best in upper stretch, shook clear outside the sixteenth-pole and held under steady urging. WATERVILLE dropped back between foes early then angled nicely to the inside, saved ground while reserved off the pace, swung six wide into the stretch, found her best stride in the final furlong and finished fast but was too late while up for the place. KOSUKE bumped with a rival at the start, went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked at the quarter-pole, lost the lead under a drive in upper stretch, fought with the winner into the final furlong and was out-kicked while able to get the show. LADY OF THOROTON had her head turned while held by the assistant starter in the neighboring outside stall and was off very slow, saved ground on the first turn, was unhurried at the back, moved out on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch and improved position then came between foes late to earn the last spot in the superfecta. SNOWY EVENING steadied while in tight between foes early, dropped towards the inside, saved ground on the first turn, was rated off the pace, went around the far turn in the two path, shifted four wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick. GALLEY HEAD bumped with a rival at the start, bumped with that same foe early, was well placed just off the pace on the inside, came under urging on the far turn, chased under a drive into the final furlong and also lacked the needed kick. LADY JASMINE bumped with a rival early, checked into the first turn then stumbled while clipping heels, dropped from the four path to the two path on that bend, settled off the pace, was roused in the two path on the final turn, came three wide at the quarter-pole, raced between foes in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. SALS DREAM GIRL bumped with opponents on both sides early then dropped back, was carried out some into the first turn, went five then four wide on that bend, settled off the pace, was urged along passing the half-mile pole, traveled three wide on the far turn, swung six wide into the stretch and failed to rally. SOLIB was very rank under tight restraint into the first turn then checked sharply, dropped from four to three wide on that bend, was rated outside but with cover, rounded the far turn in the three path, shifted five wide into the stretch and also failed to rally. FROM HELLO brushed the outside of the gate at the start, lugged out while eager into the first turn then checked very sharply, dropped from the three path to the rail on that bend, was reserved on the inside, turned into the stretch in the two path and also lacked the needed response. SARATOGA CHROME was carried out some into the first turn, dropped from the six path to the three path on that bend, was reserved on the outside but with cover, went three wide on the far turn, spun five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. SWEETEST PRINCESS had a foe clip her heels early on the turn, went three wide on that bend, was rated on the outside without the benefit of cover, came under urging in the three path on the far turn, chased four wide into upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: From Hello
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd gate,rank,came out6-1/2,chckd bad,ins2nd,2p1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Solib
ENTRY.COMMENT: very rank,checked 6-1/2,4-3p,rated outside,3p2nd,5p1/4,no rally

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,to front,ins pace,ask1/4,headed3/16,outkicked,held3rd

ENTRY.COMMENT: head turned,unprepared brk,off very slw,ins-2p,4p1/4,improved

ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell David E and Powers Sandra
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6-3p1st,reserved outside,3p2nd,5w1/4,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 5 1/2F Turf CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMIN G PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare AssessmentD ue At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLAYLIST coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside from just off the pace, slipped three wide at the head of the stretch roused for the drive, rallied to take command nearing the eighth pole, dug in under threat swapping lead changes and racing a bit erratic late while gamely holding to the finish. BOWL OF CHERRIES just off the inside tracking the front from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong, dug in under a drive fighting on to the finish but was ultimately staved off. BREEZE EASY (GB) came under a firm hold chasing three to four wide down the backstretch, tucked inside through the turn and remained on hold until lightly coaxed swinging four wide into upper stretch, got taken in hand on pause straightened away in behind LADY MILAGRO unable to alter out with a rival passing in that lane, tipped out near the eighth pole and was roused at that station after BOWL OF CHERRIES cleared to the outside and ran on to secure the show honors. GLITTER UP prompted the pace of BOMBDIGGITY from the two path coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch taking over command, dug in under threat and was collared just outside the eighth pole, weakened in the late stages. LADY MILAGRO lunged at the start getting away last and conceding two to three lengths to the front, advanced to chase four then three wide in aim of the top pair, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and went four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and weakened in the late going. TRACY ANN'S LEGACY three wide in pursuit, got lightly and briefly coaxed angled five wide into upper stretch, tired in the stretch. BOMBDIGGITY hustled from the gate, showed the way coaxed along the inside under pressure from GLITTER UP, yielded the front taking the inside route at the quarter pole, then tired through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Playlist
ENTRY.OWNER: Westerberg Magnier Mrs John Poulin Jonathan Smith Derrick and Tabor Michael B
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, roused 3w upper, up near 1/8, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Bombdiggity
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, coaxed inside under pressure, yielded 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bowl of Cherries
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 5/16, angled 5-6w upper, dug in, fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Breeze Easy (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and Reeves Thoroughbred Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: firm hold 3-4w early, ins turn, 4w uppr, beh foe to 1/8, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Milagro
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged st, chased 4-3w, coaxed near 1/4, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Glitter Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 2p, coaxed near 1/4, up 2w 1/4p, collared, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Tracy Ann's Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, lightly coaxed angled 5w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Pre ferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICHIBAN broke out at the start, pressed then stalked the pace on the outside, ranged up in the three path on the turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, took the lead outside the quarter-pole then moved clear, was challenged by the runner-up in upper stretch, responded well when put to a left-handed crop coming to the furlong marker, disposed of the runner-up near the sixteenth-pole, switched to a right-handed crop in the final sixteenth and prevailed under good handling. FOXY CARA was urged along off the pace, chased in the five path on the turn, gained near the five-sixteenths, made an outside bid in upper stretch, fought on even terms with the winner into the final furlong, was turned away near the sixteenth-pole and outfinished while well clear for the place. BON ADIEU settled off the pace, was asked while two then three wide on the turn, was driven four wide into the stretch and narrowly earned the show while no match for the top two. MIM was forwardly placed on the outside, chased four wide on the turn and tired. ISLAND ROSE settled well back in the field, traveled five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. KRYSTALHEIR settled off the pace, was urged along late on the backstretch, went three wide under extra left-rein pressure on the turn, spun five wide into the stretch and was no factor. SWEET LIBERTY brushed with a foe early, set the pace under pressure, vied in the two path for most of the turn, dropped to the rail while losing the lead late on that bend and gave way. MONTAUK MYSTIQUE was hustled from the gate, pressed the pace on the inside of the leader, dropped back while inside early on the turn, moved to the two path late on that bend and capitulated. SHOTGUN PATSY settled off the pace, moved out late on the backstretch, was roused three then four wide on the turn, dropped back five wide into the stretch and had nothing left. EMBRACEABLE GAL bobbled slightly after the start then lacked early speed, angled out near the five-eighths pole then reached the outside of the field, rounded the turn in the six path and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Embraceable Gal
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled bit after brk,angled out 5/8,6p turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Patsy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,moved out 4-1/2,roused 3-4w turn,5w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Krystalheir
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,urged along 1/2,3path turn,5p1/4,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Montauk Mystique
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pressed inside leader,drop back 7/16,ins-2p,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Bon Adieu
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,asked 2-3path turn,4path1/4,no match top two,up show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Kelso S. - Grade3 SARATOGA RACE 9 1M Inner turf CR: 108. Stakes Purse 175000. INNER TURF FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. This is a Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $175 each which should accompany the nomination. $875 to pass the entry box and an additio nal $875 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $875 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to sec ond, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One in 2022-23 at a mile or over allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade Two or Grade Three in 2022-23 at a mile or over allow ed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to theM
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CASA CREED three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide down the backstretch, began to advance placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command just inside the three-sixteenths, edged clear under a drive to prevail. ANNAPOLIS bumped after the start with ICE CHOCOLAT due to pressure from BIG EVEREST, settled two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to chase the winner home while along safe for the place honors. ENGLISH BEE tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under a drive running on to secure the show honors. ICE CHOCOLAT (BRZ) got bumped between foes and was pinched out after the start due to mostly pressure from BIG EVEREST, saved ground at the tail of the field, came under coaxing just past the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch and kept on under a drive to the finish. BIG EVEREST (GB) came inwards just after the start bumping ICE CHOCOLAT into ANNAPOLIS and pinching back that middle foe when ANNAPOLIS held his lane, showed the way in hand along the inside patiently handled, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and was roused straightened away, was collared just inside the three-sixteenths pole and weakened in the late stages. FILO DI ARIANNA (BRZ) forwardly placed tracking the leader in closest aim just off the inside, remained patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. ANACONDA two to three wide in pursuit, got coaxed along at the five-sixteenths, continued two to three wide at the head of the stretch, weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: English Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, dug in, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sanford S. - Grade3 SARATOGA RACE 10 6F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 175000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. This is a Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $175 each which should accompany the nomination; $875 to pass the entry box and an additional $875 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $875 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4%to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden or claiming allowed 2 lbs.; maidens allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, July 1, 2023 withh 14 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YO YO CANDY bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, established a good position just off the pace, stalked the leading duo while two then three wide on the turn, shifted four wide into the stretch, gained to take the lead coming to the furlong marker, shook clear outside the sixteenth-pole and held under steady urging. GOLD SWEEP stumbled badly at the start then was bumped and forced in, spotted the front several lengths, settled towards the rear, angled in around the nine-sixteenths, was roused three then four wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch, gained outside into the final furlong and finished willingly for the place. DICKENS was fractious in the gate then hustled from the start, set the pace under pressure to his outside, was asked for more along the rail on the turn, turned into upper stretch in the two path while on even terms for the advantage, fought on well into the final furlong and was outfinished while willingly holding the show. TRIPLE TREA bumped twice with a foe early, settled under some urging, came under stronger encouragement in the three path on the turn, was driven five wide into the stretch, chased between foes into the final furlong and flattened out then just missed the show. CALL THE CAVALRY was well placed just off the pace, came under urging along the rail on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, moved out inside the three-sixteenths, pursued the leaders into the final furlong and weakened then was vanned off after the race. MARKET STREET stumbled at the start then came in and bumped with a foe, moved up to press the pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the turn, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, battled under a drive into the final furlong and tired. JIVE raced just off the pace between horses, dropped back at the nine-sixteenths, was urged while inside to the two path on the turn then driven three wide into the stretch and came up empty. HIS RIGHTS dropped back early then was urged along at the rear, angled in near the nine-sixteenths, went four then three wide on the turn and failed to threaten. RAMMING SPEED bumped with a rival at the start, bumped twice with a different opponent early, was urged along off the pace, dropped back four wide on the turn and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.OWNER: Back Racing LLC Run for LaRoses and Magdalena Racing (Sherri McPeek)
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,asked rail turn,2p1/4,mvd out,weakened,vanned off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 5 1/2F Turf CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONET NEVER (IRE) chased along the inside from mid pack, remained patiently handled spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, got roused straightened away, closed well through to the finish and was just up in the final jump to score. CITY FEVER was bumped at the start by TWO MINUTES APART due to pressure from AMERICAN KNOW HOW, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive closing well outside, had AMERICAN KNOW HOW drift out a sixteenth out and was herded a path and just missed at the finish. AMERICAN KNOW HOW broke in at the start bumping METALLURGIC into TWO MINUTES APART through to CITY FEVER, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch, took command at the three-sixteenths, dug in under a drive drifting out a sixteenth out and herding CITY FEVER a path before being nailed by a pair in the final strides to the finish. CIGARETTE BOAT hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside down the backstretch, floated to the two path at the seven-sixteenths forcing FLAT TOP BOX to steady at that station, remained just off the inside through to into upper stretch, was collared with three-sixteenths remaining, ran on through to the finish to preserve the last major share. BAIE LONGUE three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. PARTY WITH SMARTY steadied at the start when CITY FEVER came inwards due to a chain of bumping begun by AMERICAN KNOW HOW, chased three then four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and improved position to the finish. BEER RUN chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened. PAXSATIONAL broke in at the start bumping NICKEL NICKEL, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide for home and offered no response. METALLURGIC was bumped at the start by AMERICAN KNOW HOW and in turn bumped TWO MINUTES APART into CITY FEVER, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide for home and tired. NICKEL NICKEL got bumped at the start by PAXSATIONAL who broke inwards, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home and tired. TWO MINUTES APART got bumped and pinched back at the start conceding four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased along the inside under coaxing from three furlongs out, swung four wide into upper stretch and made no impact. FLAT TOP BOX coaxed from the gate, raced forwardly placed just off the inside, got steadied when CIGARETTE BOAT floated directly in front to the two path with seven-sixteenths to go, lost about two lengths of ground as a result, swung four wide into upper stretch lightly and briefly urged, then was not persevered with and folded.

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, 2w 1/4p, roused str away, closed well, just up
